page.title: 19LIFE AT SCHOOL NEAR WOODFORD
page.content: There are ten dormitories in our school, they are named after birds or wild flowers. We are woken up at 7.30 each morning by a matron,and we get dressed and wash and strip back our beds to air them. About ten minutes later a bell rings and we go down to the big form room and line up in our clubs. When we are all quiet we go and fetch a bowl and take some cereal. Every one can choose what she likes. After breakfast we go upstairs and make our beds & tidy our dorms, then the bell goes for prayers. On Fridays we have "clubs"; at the beginning of term the headmistress chooses four leaders and the rest are divided up into 4 clubs, we all line up in our clubs & all the teachers sit on chairs, the club leaders call out how many stars we have and we see which club has the most stars.
